title: Honey mustard and garlic spatchcock chicken with sweet potato and mint mash
description: Spatchcock chicken takes far less cooking time than a regular whole roast chicken so don’t be alarmed! If you are a little bit squeamish about opening up a chicken this way then get your butcher to do it for you, who I am sure will happily oblige. However it is great practice to be able to do it yourself.
ingredients: flaked sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
a few sprigs fresh thyme, leaves picked and roughly chopped, plus extra sprigs to garnish
1kg/2lb 4oz sweet potatoes (or potatoes), peeled and cut into large chunks
1 bunch spring onions, trimmed and finely sliced
½ bunch mint, leaves picked and roughly torn
